synset.gloss: (geology) the geological features of the earth
a slowly moving mass of ice

synset.words: Alpine glacier, Alpine type of glacier
synset.gloss: a glacier that moves down from a high valley
a glacier that spreads out from a central mass of ice
a glacier near the Arctic or Antarctic poles

synset.words: Piedmont glacier, Piedmont type of glacier
synset.gloss: a type of glaciation characteristic of Alaska; large valley glaciers meet to form an almost stagnant sheet of ice
a large mass of ice floating at sea; usually broken off of a polar glacier
a small iceberg or ice floe just large enough to be hazardous for shipping
a mass of ice and snow that permanently covers a large area of land (e.g., the polar regions or a mountain peak)
a large flat mass of ice (larger than an ice floe) floating at sea
a flat mass of ice (smaller than an ice field) floating at sea
